application_type_full: Prior Approval: Change of use - offices to dwellinghouses
description: Change of use of Office space at ground floor (Class B1) into a 2 bed 4p, Flat (Class C3)
decision_conditions: Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, evidence showing that the development has achieved internal water usage rates of no greater than 105L per person per day have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Once approved, any measures necessary to meet the targets shall be maintained throughout the lifetime of the development.Reason: In the interests of sustainability and energy conservation, in accordance with policies CS1, DM3 and DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, details of waste and recycling facilities to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The refuse and recycling facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development are either stored within these facilities or internally within the building(s) on the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material is stored or placed for collection on the public highway except on the day of collection.Reason: To ensure proper waste management in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy SI 7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS9 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, details of secure cycle parking facilities to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The cycle parking facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained for that purpose and kept free from obstruction thereafter.Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this approval relates must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the prior approval date.Reason: As required by Paragraph O.2(2) of Part 3 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
The proposal would comply with the criteria of Class O of Part 3 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
For the avoidance of doubt, please confirm the description 'Erection of a single storey side and rear, first floor rear extension and internal alteration'.
We have received an email regardoing the tree report, however the proposed site has TPO, therefore please submit, 'Tree Report/Statement'.

Inspection: Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment: The works proposed are acceptable and will not have an adverse effect on the trees or reduce its amenity value. Recommendation: No objections

You are reminded that condition 18 (ii) remains to be discharged and requires that  Prior to occupation a Secured by Design certificate or its equivalent awarded by a Designing Out Crime Officer from the Metropolitan Police Service on behalf of the National Police Chiefs Council shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.The Desing Out Crime Officer advises that  the submitted documentation in relation to condition 26 and I am satisfied this meets the needs required to discharge the pre-commencement part of the condition.However, as I have not had the opportunity to consult with the applicant regarding the security needs of this development I would like to stress the following;- I would like to remind the applicant that the doors and windows must be 3rd party tested and certified to the minimum security standard of PAS24:2022. - PIR lighting is not recommended as an effective lighting system as will often falsely triggerdue to animals and therefore will not alert persons reliably to an intruder. Dusk 'til dawn  lighting is preferred to the appropriate lumens. - External bicycle parking facilities will be designed for secure storage using bicycle lockers, hangers or dedicated storage devices. This is the preferred option for cycle storage as they are tested and secure. They are to be certificated to one of the following minimum standards, or above (listed here alphanumerically): - LPS 1175 Issue 7 Security Rating 2, or LPS 1175 Issue 8 Security Rating B3, or LPS 2081 Issue 1 Security Rating B, or Sold Secure SS104 Silver, or STS 205 Issue 7 Burglar Resistance BR2, or STS 225 Issue 2 Burglar Resistance BR2(S), or 88 STS 501 Security Rating TR2, or STS 503 Security Rating TR2 64.2 Sheds used for bicycle parking 64.4 Where family bicycle parking is provided in a robust garden shed, the minimum requirements for the shed construction and security are as follows: -38x50mm (minimum) planed timber frame Floor and roof constructed from 11mm boards (minimum) - 11x125mm (minimum) tongue and grooved board walls and door- No window to be present Door hinges should be coach-bolted through the shed structure or secured with security or non-return screws - Two hasp and staples certificated to Sold Secure SS303 Bronze (minimum), should  be used. One positioned 200mm - 300mm down from the top of the door and one positioned 200mm - 300mm up from the bottom of the door. - Additionally, hasp and staples should be coach bolted through the shed structure or secured with either security or no return screws - Both padlocks should be certificated to either LPS 2081 Security Rating 1 or Sold Secure SS303 Bronze (minimum) Shall be securely fixed to a suitable substrate foundation - Bicycles and other property that are to be stored within the shed should have a security ground anchor system, wall mounted shed shackle or bicycle stand and shall also meet the minimum requirements within paragraph - All products should be securely fixed to suitable foundations in accordance with the manufacturer's specificationsI would also like to take this opportunity to remind the applicant that they are solely responsible for any risk for noncompliance any standards that have been required at the time of the build by Secured by Design. Secured by Design (SbD) is an initiative that works to improve the security of buildings and their immediate surroundings to provide safe places to live, work, shop and visit. SbD is the Police Preferred Specification and provides a recognised standard for all security products that can deter and reduce crime. SbD has produced a series of Design Guides to assist the building, design and construction industry to incorporate security into developments. It is therefore recommended that the applicant consider the appropriate best practice design guidance and approved tested products which can be found at the Secure by Design website www.securedbydesign.com.
